name: queryEach
syntax: queryEach(query, function(row [, currentRow] [, query] ){} [, parallel] [, maxThreads])
description: Iterates over query rows and passes each row per iteration to a callback function

params.name: callback
params.description: Closure or a function reference that will be called for each of the iteration.

callback_params.description: A struct with all of the columns for the current iteration
callback_params.name: row

callback_params.description: The value for the current iteration
callback_params.name: currentRow

callback_params.description: A reference of the original struct
callback_params.name: query

params.name: maxThreads
params.description:
Lucee4.5+ Maximum number of threads executed
If `parallel` argument is set to false it will be ignored

lucee.notes: When called as a member function query.each() is chainable.

examples.title: Iterate over query rows instead of cfloop()
examples.code: news = queryNew("id,title", "integer,varchar", [{ "id": 1, "title": "Dewey defeats Truman" }, { "id": 2, "title": "Man walks on Moon" }] ); function newsRow(row) { writeOutput(""); writeOutput("#row.id#"); writeOutput("#row.title#"); writeOutput(""); } queryEach(news,newsRow);
examples.result:
1 Dewey defeats Truman
2 Man walks on Moon

examples.title: Iterate over query rows instead of cfloop()
examples.code: news = queryNew("id,title", "integer,varchar", [{ "id": 1, "title": "Dewey defeats Truman" }, { "id": 2, "title": "Man walks on Moon" }] ); function newsRow(row) { writeOutput(""); writeOutput("#row.id#"); writeOutput("#row.title#"); writeOutput(""); } #queryEach(news,newsRow)#
examples.result:
1 Dewey defeats Truman
2 Man walks on Moon
